title: The Mechanism of the Joke:  Jordan Peterson, Truth, Love, Transcendence, the Presence of the Divine
description:
A wide ranging discussion on the nature of humor mixed with Jordan Peterson’s insights about the structure of reality.

For more from Karen Wong and The Meaning Code channel:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgp_r6WlBwDSJrP43Mz07GQ/videos
www.karenwongart.com

For more from Annette Poizner:
Information about personal counseling, life coaching and full guide to publications including articles, books and media about this work:
Annette Poizner, MSW, Ed.D., RSW
Lobster University Press (an imprint which explores the work of Dr. Jordan Peterson)

Her blog on The Times of Israel:  https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/author/annette-poizner/

Knock Knock: the Kabbalah of Comedy:  a book by Annette Poizner
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08F82S6SW/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=psychology407-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B08F82S6SW&linkId=7712dcb6a3a0713a8db1079055ee4839

From Chaos to Order by Annette Poizner:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B088DKF9SQ/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=psychology407-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B088DKF9SQ&linkId=c6167cf998b2372c50fd9bb6c484c7af

The Way Up: A Faith Based Introduction to Maps of Meaning
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07ZTMV4JP/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=psychology407-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07ZTMV4JP&linkId=99bc1d3a2e79e09a87d1e1867ba36f31

Maps of Meaning: An Illustrated Guide
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07XBSL2C7/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=psychology407-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07XBSL2C7&linkId=01ba8f34ad4ab98419ec497d89f1a648

In Good Standing: Using Jordan Peterson’s Insights to Sort Yourself Out
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B085HY5JLD/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=psychology407-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B085HY5JLD&linkId=6f9c211f7e6f7a6435c95bce7cc6b2de

The Aha of Ha Ha - the Kabbalah on Ellen’s Fall from Grace: an article by Annette Poizner
Published in the Times of Israel
ap.annettepoizner.com

A joke starts with order, then throws us into madness.
Humor has been a Jewish panacea.
Rhoda is a schlemiel, also an alchemist. There’s a revelation in it.
The epiphany gives you another way to look at the situation.

Laughter is an affection
Immanuel Kant quote… “In everything that is to excite a lively convulsive laugh there must be something absurd (in which the understanding, therefore, can find no satisfaction). Laughter is an affection arising from the sudden transformation of a strained expectation into nothing.”

Mazeltopf - may you have good flow.

Humor is an analog of divinity, from higher to lower - there’s always a reversal.
When a baby is born, everything that is closed opens. Everything that is open closes.
You are in the terrain of the sacred. It can take you amazing places or to places of degradation.

In the beginning, God…
With every new creation, you have a new mask of nature. We have to puncture the veil of the mask of nature in order to get a glimpse of God. He conceals Himself because if we could see Him straight on, we would be blinded by His glory.

Mary Tyler Moore Show
Mary Richards is the one everyone wants to be. Phyllis is the one no one wants to be.
Rhoda os the one we probably are.

The door of paradox is the door of the divine. A good writer peppers his script with dichotomies.
The polarity is the unified divine spark.

Timing is the pregnant pause - dosing out a little bit of nothing before something arrives.

A joke is a reversal. First it goes up and then goes down or vice versa. Plus one to minus one which brings us back to nothing.

Emily Dickinson poem, Tell All the Truth.
https://www.poetryfoundation.org/poems/56824/tell-all-the-truth-but-tell-it-slant-1263

Jonathan Pageau videos
The Joker:  https://youtu.be/H74BbcTs6xs
Kanye West:  https://youtu.be/b1LjF9FnM5g

Rhoda episode
Visiting the Levys:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aIFfgiHkyyA&t=8s

Knock Knock: the Kabbalah of Comedy:  a book by Annette Poizner
The Aha of Ha Ha - the Kabbalah on Ellen’s Fall from Grace: an article by Annette Poizner
Published in the Times of Israel
